de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.pipeline.filters

Class ScalingFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.pipeline.filters.AbstractFilter
      • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.pipeline.filters.ScalingFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NetworkDataSink, NetworkDataSource

    public class ScalingFilter
extends AbstractFilter
    This class scales sensor values. It maps the sensor data from [-sourceRange, sourceRange] to [-targetRange, targetRange]. It is useful for converting sensor values into value ranges that are more easily usable.

    Values exceeding the source range will be mapped to the corresponding extremum of the target range.

    The source and target ranges may be set using one of the various constructors, or setSourceRange(float) and setTargetRange(float).

    If the source and target range have not been manually set, no scaling will be executed.

    • Field Summary

      The [-sourceRange, sourceRange] the data should be mapped from
      private float mTargetRange
      The [-targetRange, targetRange] the data should be projected to

      • ScalingFilter

        public ScalingFilter(@Nullable
                     NetworkDataSink dataSink)
        Create a new ScalingFilter
        Parameters:
        dataSink - either a valid network data sink, or null.

        If null, a NetworkDataSink must be set before using the filter, see AbstractFilter.setDataSink(NetworkDataSink).

      • ScalingFilter

        public ScalingFilter()
        Create a new ScalingFilter.

        A NetworkDataSink must be set before using the filter, see AbstractFilter.setDataSink(NetworkDataSink), as is done automatically be FilterPipelineBuilder

        public ScalingFilter(float targetRange,
                     float sourceRange)
        Create a new ScalingFilter.

        A NetworkDataSink must be set before using the filter, see AbstractFilter.setDataSink(NetworkDataSink), as is done automatically be FilterPipelineBuilder

        Parameters:
        sourceRange - The [-sourceRange, sourceRange] the data should be mapped from
        targetRange - The [-targetRange, targetRange] the data should be projected to

      • ScalingFilter

        public ScalingFilter(float targetRange,
                     float sourceRange,
                     @Nullable
                     NetworkDataSink sink)
        A filter that normalizes the sensorData into usable input
        Parameters:
        sink - either a valid network data sink, or null. if null, AbstractFilter.setDataSink(NetworkDataSink) must be called prior to starting operations.
        sourceRange - The [-sourceRange, sourceRange] the data should be mapped from
        targetRange - The [-targetRange, targetRange] the data should be projected to

    • Method Detail

      • normalize

        private void normalize(float[] sensorData)
        Normalizes the sensorData
        Parameters:
        sensorData - the data received by the sensor

      • setSourceRange

        public void setSourceRange(float range)
        Change the range within which the source data lies
        Parameters:
        range - float maximum. the minimum will be negative range.

      • setTargetRange

        public void setTargetRange(float targetRange)
        Change the resulting target range, as in the projection target range
        Parameters:
        targetRange - the magnitude of the minimum and maximum values

      • onData

        public void onData(NetworkDevice origin,
                   SensorData sensorData,
                   float userSensitivity)
        Called when the next element should be filtered.
        Parameters:
        origin - the network device which sent the data
        sensorData - the sensor data
        userSensitivity - the sensitivity the user requested in his app settings for the sensor the data is from
